comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Also, a girl's best friend! I have one holding up a fishbowl, a two-drawer version of that four-drawer one in the foreground.

comment.author: 54968992@N03
comment._content:
My Mum had one of these up to ten years ago, my own kids loved playing with it when they were toddlers in the 80's.
These can go for a nice little sum  depending on their condition.
Nice shot Carol.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: My late mother had one just like the one in the foreground.  It was also a very ingenious device.  The machine tilted on hinges, you lifted the table it sat on out of the way, again on hinges, the machine folded down below the level of the table and the whole thing closed up so that you had a neat table/worktop with a fancy singer stand beneath.  I remember rooting through drawers like those and finding bobbins and reels and being fascinated by the movement of the bobbin underneath the baseplate!

comment.author: 8214568@N08
comment._content: The factory in the poster is of the Kilbowie Road, Clydebank factory, with its distinctive clock tower.

comment.author: 8214568@N08
comment._content: The Russian poster "Компания Зингеръ Швейная машиъі" means 'The Singer Sewing Machine Company".

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Love the video! Betty Hutton's usually a lot more glamourous. And is the machine still part of your fishbowl "stand"?

comment.author: 58930216@N04
comment._content: At one stage, and they may well still be there, the Rathcoole Inn in Dublin had bar tables made out of redundant Singer sowing machine lower halves.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content:
Yes, the machine is folded, and the fishbowl sits on the closed lid. All the various bits are there, and still work if you are an expert, but no-one in our house is.

The blank panel on the front is a bottom-hinged secret flip drawer.

And they weighed a ton!! Love the little smocks!!  ;)

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: The original railway at Kilbowie was diverted to allow the Singer factory to be built. Singer Railway Station is still in use. www.geograph.org.uk/photo/731908

comment.author: 56105315@N07
comment._content: I, or rather my wife, has that very 4 drawer machine!

comment._content: This is very likely taken at their shop at 84 The Quay. Its the second shop on the left in this postcard where the car is parked
